Sheet1.Name: Amabilis fir
Sheet1.Description: Branches tiered; needles flat, dark green, 2 white lines underneath, spreading forward and upward, spirally arranged, most 1-2.5(-4.5) cm x 1-3 mm; female cones erect, ovoid-cylindrical, resinous, purple-grey before turning brown, most 8-10 cm x 4-5 cm with deciduous scales about 2x2 cm, finely pubescent, bracts shorty and usually hidden between the scales. Winter ID: buds small, spherical, brown, with violet wax.
Sheet1.color: No flowers, Brown, red, maturing to yellow

Sheet1.Name: Chinese lantern
Sheet1.Description: Leaves usually lobed like a maple; flowers cup-shaped, about 5 cm wide; fruit rounded, capsule-like.
Sheet1.color: Showy, Orange, White, Pink, Red, Yellow

Sheet1.Name: chenille plant
Sheet1.Description: Plant upright; stem is lined with fine hairs; leaves ovate, dark green, margin toothed; tiny florets in fuzzy red "catkins

Sheet1.Name: Freeman maple, columnar red maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves about 10 cm wide, 3-5 palmate lobes, coarsely toothed, pale underneath

Sheet1.Name: trident maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves opposite, usually with three forward pointing lobes; samaras green to red over summer before ripening in the fall.

Sheet1.Name: vine maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves rounded, serrated with shallow lobes and nine major veins palmately arranged. Winter ID: fringe of fine white hairs on base of buds, green bark.

Sheet1.Name: Douglas maple, Rocky Mountain maple
Sheet1.Description: Often a shrubby tree with reddish young twigs; leaves 3-5 lobed, coarsely double-toothed; samara wings V-shaped to nearly parallel.

Sheet1.Name: paperbark maple
Sheet1.Description: Bark cinnamon (orange-red), papery, exfoliating; leaves trifoliate, leaflets lobed, bright red fall colour. Winter ID: exfoliating bark, buds sharply pointed, dark purplish-brown

Sheet1.Name: fernleaf maple, fernleaf full moon maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves long, ovate lobes, acuminate, doubly serrate, highly dissected, palmately cut. Winter ID: buds look like a moose hoof with hair around the base

Sheet1.Name: bigleaf maple
Sheet1.Description: Habit is low branching; leaves large (30 cm), mid-green, palmate with 5 lobes (3 major lobes); florets in pendulous racemes. Winter ID: buds large (10 mm), green, opposite; samaras large, covered with hairs.

Sheet1.Name: Manitoba maple , box elder
Sheet1.Description: Leaves opposite, compound, odd-pinnate with 3(-5) toothed leaflets; florets in pendant clusters, dioecious, greenish-yellow, male florets with dark red anthers; samaras persistent.

Sheet1.Name: Japanese maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves red-tipped, palmate (most with 7 broad lobes). Winter ID: buds, ovoid, have light brown hairs on a papery sheath that extends halfway up.

Sheet1.Name: Koto No Ito maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves deeply dissected, palmate with 3 to 5 narrow, jagged-edged lance-shaped leaflets (reminiscent of cannabis); samaras persistent, red and green.

Sheet1.Name: Chishio Japanese maple
Sheet1.Description: Small, upright Japanese maple with 7-lobed serrated leaves turning from red (spring) to green (summer) to red (fall).

Sheet1.Name: Shojo Nomura maple
Sheet1.Description: Small tree with red, 5 to 7 lobed serrated leaves about 6 cm wide.

Sheet1.Name: red nail maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves red-tipped, palmate (most with 7 broad lobes).

Sheet1.Name: red-leaf Japanese maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves simple, palmately 5-7 lobed, simple, red-purple, serrated margin; stems new growth purple. Winter ID: buds, ovoid, have light brown hairs on a papery sheath that extends halfway up.

Sheet1.Name: dissected red Japanese maple
Sheet1.Description: Slow-growing shrub, broadly arching; leaves opposite, finely toothed, deeply lobed or palmately compound, deep purple, turning bright red or orange in fall.

Sheet1.Name: moosewood maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves 3 forward-pointing lobes; florets yellow, about 1 cm wide, imperfect; Winter ID: buds opposite, oval, red; bark striped green/black.

Sheet1.Name: Norway maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves palmate with 5 lobes deeply incised, looks like Canadian flag leaf; petiole is long, broken leaf veins or petiole ooze milky sap. Winter ID: buds opposite, large, plump green/burgundy; samara wings held at wide angle (widely divergent wings - unlike sycamore maple)

Sheet1.Name: Crimson King Norway maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves palmate with 5 lobes deeply incised, dark red, looks like Canadian flag leaf; petiole is long, broken leaf veins or petiole ooze milky sap. Winter ID: buds opposite, large, plump green/burgundy; samaras held at wide angle.
Sheet1.color: Purple, Dark-red, dark purple when mature
Sheet1.texture: Purple, Dark-red, dark purple when mature

Sheet1.Name: Crimson Sentry maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves deep purple (crimsons-oranges in fall), cupped like ladle on long (20 cm) petiole, petiole with milky sap. Winter ID: buds dark red to almost black; upward curled branches (fastigiate).

Sheet1.Name: Princeton Gold Norway maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves palmate with 5 lobes deeply incised, looks like Canadian flag leaf; petiole is long, broken leaf veins or petiole ooze milky sap. Winter ID: buds opposite, large, plump green/burgundy; samaras held at wide angle.

Sheet1.Name: sycamore maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves palmate with 5 lobes, 10-25 cm long; florets in pendulous panicles.

Sheet1.Name: red maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves with 3 major lobes with soft serrations, fall colour vibrant red; terminal buds multiple; samaras red, narrower angle compared to A. platanoides. Winter ID: buds small (3 mm) red opposite; flower buds in large clusters circle twigs, give branches a bumpy look.

Sheet1.Name: Bowhall maple
Sheet1.Description: Form very narrow; leaf three major lobes, mid-green, lighter underside, 10 cm petiole. Winter ID: buds opposite, red on brownish twigs; bark grayish.

Sheet1.Name: Red Sunset maple
Sheet1.Description: Vigorous cultivar with strong wood; leaves with 3 major lobes with soft serrations, fall colour vibrant red; terminal buds multiple; samaras red, narrower angle compared to Norway maple. Winter ID: buds small (3 mm) red opposite; flower buds in large clusters circle twigs, give branches a bumpy look.

Sheet1.Name: silver maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves to 15 cm long with 5 lobes, lower surface silvery.

Sheet1.Name: sugar maple
Sheet1.Description: Leaves like Canadian flag, fine white hairs on base of underside. Winter ID: buds brown, 3 mm, pointed, adpressed, terminal bud.

Sheet1.Name: Lady Fern
Sheet1.Description: Fronds deciduous, thrice pinnate, elliptical, grooved rachis, up to 90 cm long, stipe may have long, brown papery scales near the base, arising from a clump (not along a rhizome); sori dot-like on undersides of pinnae, up to 6 per pinnule, indusium light brown, kidney-shaped.

Sheet1.Name: deer fern
Sheet1.Description: Fronds are deeply-lobed, rachis dark brown: vegetative fronds are vase-shaped then becoming horizontal and evergreen; reproductive fronds are upright with much narrower pinnae, lower surface with two thick rows of sori.

Sheet1.Name: Royal fern
Sheet1.Description: Large shade-loving fern; fronds about 1 m tall, mid green, openly odd-pinnate; pinnae about 4 cm long x 13 mm wide, attached to rachis by a <1 mm stalk.

Sheet1.Name: spicy hot pepper
Sheet1.Description: Berries smaller and more elongated (most species) than for the sweet pepper.

Sheet1.Name: Jerusalem cherry
Sheet1.Description: Usually grown as a winter fruiting decorative indoor plant; leaves glossy, dark green, elliptic with wavy margins, 5-8 cm long; fruit mildly poisonous if mistaken for cherry tomatoes.

Sheet1.Name: sweet basil
Sheet1.Description: Stems leggy, purple; leaves smooth and bright green or purple, opposite, ovate with serrate margins which tend to curve downwards, highly scented.

Sheet1.Name: heather
Sheet1.Description: Leaves very small and somewhat scale like, two per node but next pair rotated 90 degrees so that the stems look like an X if viewing a short stem section from the end; flower parts in 4's, blooms late summer to fall.

Sheet1.Name: maiden pink
Sheet1.Description: Plant forming a mat-like evergreen ground cover; leaves linear.

Sheet1.Name: winter creeper
Sheet1.Description: Low shrub or creeper (quick to form adventitious roots); leaves opposite, elliptic to oval, finely toothed, dark green, 2-6 cm long x 1-3 cm wide; fruit spherical, < 6 mm, white capsules with orange arils (seeds; fruit absent in some cvs.).

Sheet1.Name: Gold Plate yarrow
Sheet1.Description: Leaves deeply-dissected, 1-2 pinnatifid, hairy, fern-like, aromatic (spicy), up to 25 cm long, divided into as many as 15 pairs of linear-lanceolate toothed segments; florets tiny, long-lasting, bright golden, in small heads that appear in dense, flattened plate-like compound corymbs, 4-10 cm wide.

Sheet1.Name: garlic
Sheet1.Description: Garlic bulb; leaves linear, flattened, about 2 cm wide x 30 cm long; florets pinkish-white, in umbel to 45 cm tall in summer.

Sheet1.Name: drumstick allium
Sheet1.Description: Flowers in tight umbel (appearing like a drumstick from a distance), gradually change from green to purple.
